Incident.Summary: Traffic hazard in the area of MD 32 and Kate Wagner Rd.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Attachments: No attachments available for this supplemental report. Scene Processing: No scene processing occurred. Narrative: My assigned department patrol vehicle, G-24, has an MVR equipped and was recording at the time of the incident. My department issued BWC was operational and recording at the time of the incident. On 04/28/2023, at approximately 1407 hours, I, TFC. B. Reilly #6751, responded to the area of MD 32 at Kate Wagner Rd, Westminster, MD 21157 for down telephone poles impeding the roadway. Upon my arrival, I was briefed by the first responding units of the Carroll County Sheriffs Department, and advised the traffic pattern. They also advised the telephone poles were down due to weather related conditions. I also noticed that Verizon was on scene already assessing the situation. While Deputies were directing traffic, I canvassed the area and discovered ten consecutive poles were down in total, all stringing parallel on the east side of MD 32. The string then crossed over onto Kate Wagner Road, then across the parking lot of the Carroll County Youth Services Bureau. I discovered a total of three vehicles damaged by the downed poles and wires, which are listed below: 1. MD 1EW9765 - 2021 Ford Ranger Policy Information: State Farm Mutual Auto - 3178692D2720B 2. MD 3CW9519 - 2017 Toyota 4S Policy Information: Progressive Select - 962601586 3. MD 2DN3627 - 2015 Toyota Rav4 Policy Information: Erie Insurance 0 Q035503563 While I was obtaining information for the struck vehicles, Verizon was able to lift the cable line laying across Kate Wager Road to alleviate the traffic and school buses traveling from Gateway School. At approximately 1534 hours, SHA arrived on scene for traffic control, and a flagger contingent arrived on scene for Verizon. SHA advised that they would notify the Westminster Barrack once the roadway was reopened. All events occurred in Carroll County, MD.
